alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:06AM PDT until May 01 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Hanford CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Friday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight. The water level should peak at 10.9 feet at 2 AM PDT early Sunday morning. The water level should fall below flood stage and remain below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/09/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM PDT.
